meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The metal pot clangs against the stove.
meanings.sent2: The church bell clangs loudly at noon.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef clangs the pots and pans together in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The hammer clangs against the anvil in the blacksmith's shop.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock clangs, waking me up abruptly.

meanings.sent1: The clangs of construction work echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The clangs of the metal gate could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clangs of the wind chimes startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The clangs of the old radiator reminded her of childhood winters.
meanings.sent5: The clangs of the fire alarm filled the hallway with urgency.
